alert.note: Alert for Arapahoe; Denver; Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 9:57PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Arapahoe, Denver, Douglas and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry gulches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen across southern Aurora and the Cherry Creek reservoir area. - Southern Aurora is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Cherry Creek between the dam and downtown Denver will also experience minor overbank flooding near the bike path. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Denver, southwestern Aurora, southeastern Lakewood, Centennial, Highlands Ranch, Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Sheridan, Chatfield Reservoir, Cherry Hills Village, Foxfield, Cherry Creek Reservoir, Columbine and Ken Caryl.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
